ticket.title: [BUG] uninitialized constant ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::OpenSSL
ticket.original-body:
I'm running a Rails `3.0.0beta3` application with `ruby-1.8.7-p249` using `devise` for authentication.
Specs and Cucumber features cover authentication and signup. They all pass.
When I run '`rails server`' (powered by `Webrick`), the first page is displayed correctly however any next page I attempt to display raises the following error:
Error during failsafe response: ActionView::Template::Error (uninitialized constant ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::OpenSSL) in /Users/pcreux/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.8.7-p249/gems/actionpack-3.0.0.beta3/lib/action_dispatch/middleware/templates/rescues/_request_and_response.erb
It looks like rails does not succeed to require OpenSSL on `active_support/message_verifier.rb:58` (http://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activesupport/lib/active_support/message_verifier.rb#L58)
I can't require '`openssl`' running '`rails console`': rails console Loading development environment (Rails 3.0.0.beta3) ruby-1.8.7-p249 > defined? OpenSSL => nil ruby-1.8.7-p249 > require 'openssl' => nil
It works fine running '`bundle exec irb`': bundle exec irb ruby-1.8.7-p249 > defined? OpenSSL => nil ruby-1.8.7-p249 > require 'openssl' => true ruby-1.8.7-p249 > defined? OpenSSL => "constant"
Again, all Cucumber & Specs pass.
Let me know if you need any other info. Thanks for your help!

ticket.original-body-html:
I'm running a Rails 3.0.0beta3 application with ruby-1.8.7-p249 using devise for authentication.

Specs and Cucumber features cover authentication and signup. They all pass.

When I run 'rails server' (powered by Webrick), the first page is displayed correctly however any next page I attempt to display raises the following error:

Error during failsafe response:
ActionView::Template::Error (uninitialized constant ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::OpenSSL) in /Users/pcreux/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.8.7-p249/gems/actionpack-3.0.0.beta3/lib/action_dispatch/middleware/templates/rescues/_request_and_response.erb

It looks like rails does not succeed to require OpenSSL on active_support/message_verifier.rb:58 (http://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activesupport/lib/active_...)

I can't require 'openssl' running 'rails console':

rails console
Loading development environment (Rails 3.0.0.beta3)
ruby-1.8.7-p249 > defined? OpenSSL
 => nil 
ruby-1.8.7-p249 > require 'openssl'
 => nil

It works fine running 'bundle exec irb':

bundle exec irb
ruby-1.8.7-p249 > defined? OpenSSL
 => nil 
ruby-1.8.7-p249 > require 'openssl'
 => true 
ruby-1.8.7-p249 > defined? OpenSSL
 => "constant"

Again, all Cucumber & Specs pass.

Let me know if you need any other info. Thanks for your help!

version.title: [BUG] uninitialized constant ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::OpenSSL

version.body: Did you install the libopenssl-ruby package and re-compile your Ruby install? How did you install Ruby?
version.body-html: Did you install the libopenssl-ruby package and re-compile your Ruby install? How did you install Ruby?
version.title: [BUG] uninitialized constant ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::OpenSSL

version.body: I installed Ruby with RVM on Mac OS X. I guess that the openssl lib is installed as I can require 'openssl' successfully via irb.
version.body-html: I installed Ruby with RVM on Mac OS X. I guess that the openssl lib is installed as I can require 'openssl' successfully via irb.

version.body: I have the same issue on Ubuntu karmic and with Devise.
version.body-html: I have the same issue on Ubuntu karmic and with Devise.
version.title: [BUG] uninitialized constant ActiveSupport::MessageVerifier::OpenSSL

version.body:
Just ran through the app and confirmed that this is an issue with the version of Devise we are using.
I removed the devise initializer and the application behaves as expected.
We'll look into it further with the Devise community. I'll post back after resolution.
version.body-html:
Just ran through the app and confirmed that this is an issue with the version of Devise we are using.

I removed the devise initializer and the application behaves as expected.

We'll look into it further with the Devise community. I'll post back after resolution.
